definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
one word says it all (idiom, from Analects); to cut a long story short/in a nutshell
one word worth nine sacred tripods (idiom); words of enormous weight
hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
one word worth a thousand in gold (idiom); valuable advice/words of enormous weight
to cut a long story short
lit. once said, a team of horses cannot unsay it (idiom); a promise must be kept
pinyin: yi1 yan2 ji4 chu1 , si4 ma3 nan2 zhui1

definition: each word carries weight/a promise must be kept (idiom)
a nobleman's word is his bond (proverb)
pinyin: jun1 zi3 yi1 yan2 , si4 ma3 nan2 zhui1

sentences.english: She tries to back track, but the President simply walks away.
sentences.chinese: 她試圖重新回到話題，但總統一言不發地走開了。

sentences.english: His face scrunches up. He begins to cry.
sentences.chinese: 哈雷一言未發，他的面部扭曲着，開始哭泣。

sentences.english: Whatever a teacher does in the classroom will have effect on the students.
sentences.chinese: 老師在教室裏的一言一行都會影響學生。

sentences.english: He sent forth his word and healed them, and rescued them from destruction.
sentences.chinese: 主發一言就將他們病除，且拯救他們脫離了陰府。

sentences.english: How am I doing? Well sometimes it's hard to tell.
sentences.chinese: 我生活得怎樣？有時真是一言難盡。

sentences.english: She turned and flung out without a word.
sentences.chinese: 她轉過身，一言不發就憤然離開了。

sentences.english: The pause was to Elizabeth's feelings dreadful.
sentences.chinese: 伊麗莎白心裏很奇怪，可是嘴上一言未發。

sentences.english: Jane marched out of the room without saying a word.
sentences.chinese: 簡一言未發，快步走出了房問。

sentences.english: As Palmer hugs his daughter, Sherry passes him without saying a word.
sentences.chinese: 帕默擁抱着他的女兒，雪莉一言不發地從他身邊走過。

sentences.english: He remains silent, only looks at the glass stone dully.
sentences.chinese: 他不發一言，只呆呆地望着玻璃石。

sentences.english: He led her home, but she did not speak a single word the whole way.
sentences.chinese: 然後王子領着新娘回去了，可一路上新娘卻一言不發。

sentences.english: The Queen of Scots was silent. She stood like a stone.
sentences.chinese: 蘇格蘭女王一言不發，像座石像一樣站在那裏。

sentences.english: Thee teacher's every word and action will play a silent role for students.
sentences.chinese: 教師的一言一行對學生都會起到潤物細無聲的作用。

sentences.english: You must be careful about ( as to) what you say or do.
sentences.chinese: 你一言一行都必須謹慎小心。

definition: to adopt/to pass/to vote approval (of a law etc)
to remain silent/to have nothing to say
